title: Lesbian Modernism: A Cultural Study
abstractText: Lesbian Modernism: A Cultural Study examines the cultural production and influence of the Anglo-American lesbian modernists, including Virginia Woolf, H.D., Bryher, Gertrude Stein, Dorothy Richardson, Djuna Barnes, Amy Lowell, Dora Carrington, Romaine Brooks, Gluck and Elizabeth McCausland. Reading across literary and visual texts, it examines the relationship between the innovative movements of modernism in London, Paris and New York and early twentieth-century lesbian identity.
